page.title: International reactions to the 2011 Egyptian revolution

rev.diff:
Line 137: Line 137:
* {{flag|United Kingdom}} â On 2 February Prime Minister [[David Cameron]] called for an end to the violence, describing the scenes in Cairo as "despicable" and said they should not be repeated. He said, "We have been watching the events in Cairo with grave concern, and completely condemn the violence that is taking place. And if it turns out that the regime, in any way, has been sponsoring or tolerating this violence, that would be completely and utterly unacceptable. These are despicable scenes that we are seeing and they should not be repeated. They underline the need for political reform and, frankly, for that political reform to be accelerated and to happen quickly. We need to see a clear roadmap for that political reform, so that people in Egypt can have confidence that their aspirations for a more democratic, a future with greater rights, is met. And that change needs to start happening now, and the violence needs to stop."<ref>[[Press release]] (2 February 2011). [http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/news/latest-news/?view=News&id=543389682 "Prime Minister Condemns Violence in Egypt"]. [[Foreign and Commonwealth Office]] ([[United Kingdom]]). Retrieved 2 February 2011.</ref>
* {{flag|United Kingdom}} â On 2 February Prime Minister [[David Cameron]] called for an end to the violence, describing the scenes in Cairo as "despicable" and said they should not be repeated. He said, "We have been watching the events in Cairo with grave concern, and completely condemn the violence that is taking place. And if it turns out that the regime, in any way, has been sponsoring or tolerating this violence, that would be completely and utterly unacceptable. These are despicable scenes that we are seeing and they should not be repeated. They underline the need for political reform and, frankly, for that political reform to be accelerated and to happen quickly. We need to see a clear roadmap for that political reform, so that people in Egypt can have confidence that their aspirations for a more democratic, a future with greater rights, is met. And that change needs to start happening now, and the violence needs to stop."<ref>[[Press release]] (2 February 2011). [http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/news/latest-news/?view=News&id=543389682 "Prime Minister Condemns Violence in Egypt"]. [[Foreign and Commonwealth Office]] ([[United Kingdom]]). Retrieved 2 February 2011.</ref>
*: Foreign Secretary [[William Hague]] called on the authorities and protesters in Egypt to show restraint and avoid violence. He urged the Egyptian authorities to "listen to the concerns" of demonstrators.<ref>{{cite web|author=[[Press release]]|url=http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/news/latest-news/?view=News&id=539828682 |title=Foreign Secretary on Protests in Egypt |publisher=[[Foreign and Commonwealth Office]] ([[United Kingdom]])|date=28 January 2011 |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref>
*: Foreign Secretary [[William Hague]] called on the authorities and protesters in Egypt to show restraint and avoid violence. He urged the Egyptian authorities to "listen to the concerns" of demonstrators.<ref>{{cite web|author=[[Press release]]|url=http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/news/latest-news/?view=News&id=539828682 |title=Foreign Secretary on Protests in Egypt |publisher=[[Foreign and Commonwealth Office]] ([[United Kingdom]])|date=28 January 2011 |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref>
â
** Former Prime Minister [[Tony Blair]] called Mubarak a "force for good."<ref name="bloombergreactions">Ali, Tariq ([[essay]]) (3 February 2011). [http://www.bloomberg.com/news/4 February 2011/egypt-chaos-defines-bleeding-in-despot-arab-world-commentary-by-tariq-ali.html "Egypt Chaos Defines Bleeding in Despot Arab World: Tariq Ali"]{{dead link|date=April 2011}}. ''[[Bloomberg]]''. Retrieved 5 February 2011.</ref>
+
** Former Prime Minister [[Tony Blair]] called Mubarak a "force for good."<ref name="bloombergreactions">Ali, Tariq ([[essay]]) (3 February 2011). [http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-02-04/egypt-chaos-defines-bleeding-in-despot-arab-world-commentary-by-tariq-ali.html "Egypt Chaos Defines Bleeding in Despot Arab World: Tariq Ali"]. ''[[Bloomberg]]''. Retrieved 5 February 2011.</ref>
